A technician is determining the specifications for a desktop computer that will be used at trade shows all over the world. The computer will have the maximum amount of RAM. The CPU, GPU, and storage will be typical of a business workstation.
Which of the following system parameters is the MOST important for the technician to consider when choosing a power supply?

discussion.content: It's extremely important to train whoever is using the Workstation on making sure the appropriate voltage is used depending on the location. A good surge protector and if neccesary adapter are extremley important. The wrong voltage could fry a computer in seconds or worse, shock someone when they touch the back of the case. Some Power Supplies come with voltage switches but many countries have different adaptors and requirements. Due dilligence is neccesary for the Tech to protect the person using this device.
I'm wondering why no one considered B - the Efficiency rating
That's so misleading with RAM and CPU mentions, it's just the 120-240 switch on the PSU
The answer is input voltage because the technician is traveling across the world and would be using adaptors to use power.

questions.question_text: A workstation was just moved to a new work location without a surge protector. It was working the day before, but now the PC will not power on, the fans will not spin, and there are no signs of activity. Which of the following should the technician do FIRST?

discussion.content: the simplest solution is always the first step.

A surge protector (or spike suppressor, surge suppressor, surge diverter, surge protection device (SPD) or transient voltage surge suppressor (TVSS) is an appliance or device intended to protect electrical devices from voltage spikes in alternating current (AC) circuits.

choices.B: Check the voltage of the PSU with a tester

discussion.content: The big giveaway for me here was the fact that the technician was unable to ping their default Gateway. Anytime that you are unable to ping your default gateway, it means that you are having a connection issue with your router.
